item.description:
Hello Boston Volunteers,

 

If you got a bit cramped being indoors this past weekend, here is a perfect excuse to be outdoors by the river, have some fun and help the city.

 

We will be pruning trees this weekend with Charles River Conservation along Memorial Drive. Pruning is best done during wintertime, so as not to damage trees when they are growing.

 

Location: Along the memorial drive, by the American Legion Club,

See Google map for details

http://goo.gl/maps/GLLv2

Please dress warm, bring water, wear glasses/sunglasses to protect your eyes. Work gloves and tools will be provided by Charles River Conservancy. Cheers, Nagina www.BostonVolunteer.org

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Tree Pruning along Memorial Drive: Charles River Conservation
